title: Famous Athletes
desc: Find out if you are related to a famous athlete.

people.name: Pel√©
people.desc: Greatest soccer player of all time. Named Athlete of the Century by the International Olympic Committee.

people.name: Muhammad Ali
people.desc: Greatest heavyweight boxer of all time.

people.name: Babe Ruth
people.desc: One of the greatest sports heroes in American culture and is considered by many to be the greatest baseball player of all time.

people.name: Jim Thorpe
people.desc: First Native American to win a gold medal for the United States in the Olympics.

people.name: Jesse Owens
people.desc: Won four gold medals at the 1936 Berlin Olympics on front of Hitler, crushing Hitler's myth of aryan supremacy.

people.name: Bruce Lee
people.desc: Considered to be the most influential martial artist of all time.

people.name: Wilt Chamberlain
people.desc: Standing at 7 feet 1 in, widely regarded as one of the greatest NBA players.

people.name: Kobe Bryant
people.desc: Winner of 5 NBA championships, Widely regarded as one of the greatest basketball players and scorers of all time.

people.name: Jackie Robinson
people.desc: First African American to play in Major League Baseball in the modern era.

people.name: Hank Aaron
people.desc: Considered one of the greatest baseball players in history. Broke Babe Ruth's home run record.

people.name: Mickey Mantel
people.desc: Hall of fame MLB player, regarded by many as the greatest switch hitter in baseball history.

people.name: Lou Gehrig
people.desc: MLB hall of famer. First player to have his number (4) retired by a team. The disease Amyotrophic Lateral Sclerosis is often called Lou Gehrig's Disease.

people.name: Sugar Ray Robinson
people.desc: First boxer in history to win a divisional world championship five times.

people.name: Yogi Berra
people.desc: 18-time All-Star and won 10 World Series championships as a player; more than any other player in MLB history.

people.name: John Madden
people.desc: Never having a losing season, holds the highest winning percentage among NFL head coaches who coached at least 100 games.

people.name: Arnold Palmer
people.desc: One of the greatest and most charismatic golfers. Won 62 PGA Tour titles from 1955 to 1973.

people.name: Vince Lombardi
people.desc: Considered to be the greatest coach in football history.

people.name: Evel Knievel
people.desc: An American stunt performer and entertainer. Inducted into the Motorcycle Hall of Fame in 1999.

people.name: Ty Cobb
people.desc: Cobb is widely credited with setting 90 MLB records during his career.

people.name: Jim Clark
people.desc: Most grand-Prix wins and most pole positions

people.name: Roger Bannister
people.desc: Ran the first sub-4-minute mile.

people.name: Gene Fullmer
people.desc: World middleweight champion in 1957, when he soundly upset the legendary Sugar Ray Robinson.
